alert.note: Alert for East Carteret; Hatteras Island; Ocracoke Island (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued November 10 at 3:35AM EST until November 10 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, 1 to 2 ft of inundation above ground level and minor ocean overwash in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 6 to 10 feet in the surf zone. * WHERE...East Carteret County, and Ocracoke Island and Hatteras Island. * WHEN...Until 10 AM EST this morning. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The threat of overwash and coastal flooding will be greatest within several hours of this mornings high tide, which will occur shortly after 8 AM on the beaches.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.

area.areaDesc: East Carteret; Hatteras Island; Ocracoke Island
